data.title: List of 82 James Earl Jones Movies & TV Shows, Ranked Best to Worst
data.meta_description: What are the greatest James Earl Jones movies & TV shows of all time?
data.text:
This ranking is based on an algorithm that combines various factors, including the votes of our users and search trends on the internet.

List of James Earl Jones Movies: Ranked Best To Worst

1. Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb (1964)

122

23

122

23

Undoubtedly one of the greatest dark comedies of all time, Dr. Strangelove, is a Stanley Kubrick masterpiece. A Cold War satire, the movie depicts what would happen if an unhinged powerful figure like Brigadier General Jack D. Ripper unleashes nuclear holocaust on the world.

Directed By:

2. King: A Filmed Record... Montgomery to Memphis (1970)

11

2

11

2

The documentary film biography of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., constructed using original newsreels, chronicles the important events of his Civil Rights Movement. King’s journey from a regional activist to the world-renowned leader of non-violent campaign for racial equality is captured through events from the 1955 Montgomery bus boycott to the 1968 assassination in Memphis, and also includes rare footage of his speeches, arrests, and protest-marches.

Role:

Himself

Starring:

Directed By:

3. Matewan (1987)

11

4

PG-13

11

4

Matewan is a historical drama film which tells the story of a mining community that is being brutally and violently dominated and harassed by a powerful coal company. Eventually, a labor union organizer arrives to help them, and he is aided by a considerate mayor and a helpful police chief.

Starring:

Chris Cooper, Kevin Tighe, David Strathairn, Ken Jenkins

Directed By:

John Sayles

4. The Sandlot (1993)

30

8

PG

30

8

Shy Scotty Smalls moves to San Fernando Valley and joins a local baseball team. He and his friends go on adventures throughout the town. The gang, however, runs into trouble when Scotty borrows a ball signed by Babe Ruth without his stepfather’s knowledge and it goes over a fence protected by a huge dog.

Directed By:

David Mickey Evans

5. Paul Robeson (1979)

10

3

10

3

Role:

Paul Robeson

Starring:

Burt Wallace

Directed By:

Lloyd Richards

6. Rebound: The Legend of Earl 'The Goat' Manigault (1996)

9

3

R

9

3

Role:

Dr. McDuffie

Starring:

Don Cheadle, Forest Whitaker, Michael Beach, Ronny Cox, Loretta Devine

Directed By:

Eriq La Salle

7. The Hunt for Red October (1990)

52

15

PG

52

15

At the height of the Cold War, Soviet submarine captain Marko Ramius, commanding the latest nearly undetectable nuclear missile submarine Red October, defies orders and sets course for America's east coast. After its presence is briefly detected, Jack Ryan, CIA analyst and former Marine, is given three days to confirm his theory that Ramius plans to defect.

Role:

Admiral Greer

Directed By:

John McTiernan

8. Guyana Tragedy: The Story of Jim Jones (1980)

9

3

9

3

Starring:

Veronica Cartwright, Randy Quaid, Diane Ladd, Powers Boothe, Brad Dourif, Irene Cara

Directed By:

William A. Graham

9. Field of Dreams (1989)

35

11

PG

35

11

After hearing an enigmatic voice say ‘If you build it, he will come,’ an Iowa corn-farmer Ray Kinsella, with support of his wife, decides to construct a baseball diamond in his corn-farm. Soon ‘Shoeless Joe Jackson’ appears there to play baseball. As Ray receives more messages, he understands that his ball-field is meant to be a place to realize certain unfulfilled dreams.

Role:

Terence Mann

Directed By:

Phil Alden Robinson

10. Claudine (1974)

9

3

PG

9

3

Claudine is a romantic drama film which revolves around a single mother named Claudine Price, who lives on welfare with her six kids. Her life takes a turn when she meets Rupert Marshall, but due to poverty and restrictions in the welfare system, as well as the hostility of her children, they face multiple struggles in their relationship.

Role:

Roop

Starring:

Diahann Carroll, Lawrence Hilton-Jacobs, Tamu Blackwell, David Kruger

Directed By:

John Berry

11. Coming to America (1988)

49

20

R

49

20

The crown prince of Zamunda, Akeem Joffer, leads a luxurious life and is supposed to marry a girl of his parent’s choice. However, he decides to choose his life partner himself and along with his aide, Semmi, travels to Queens for the purpose. Disguised as poor student, he finds his perfect match in Lisa McDowell, but she has a boyfriend and her father does not approve of him.

Role:

King Jaffe Joffer

Starring:

Eddie Murphy, Cuba Gooding Jr., Don Ameche, John Amos, Samuel L. Jackson, Arsenio Hall

Directed By:

John Landis

12. Sneakers (1992)

19

8

PG-13

19

8

Martin Bishop, who runs a company that tests security systems, is blackmailed by government agents into getting a black box from its inventor. Bishop’s ex-girlfriend and his team of experts, who retrieve the device, discover that it can decode any encryption code. As Bishop realizes that those men were criminals and not government officers, they incriminate him in the murder of the inventor.

Starring:

Robert Redford, Sidney Poitier, Dan Aykroyd, Ben Kingsley, River Phoenix, Donal Logue, Timothy Busfield

Directed By:

Phil Alden Robinson

9

4

PG-13

9

Starring:

16. Conan the Barbarian (1982)

36

17

R

36

17

Snake cult ruler and sorcerer Thulsa Doom destroys a tribe and then orphaned Conan is sold as a slave during childhood. Later, Conan becomes a fearless warrior and after his release, he commences on a mission to avenge his parents’ death. Accompanied by beautiful Valeria and archer Subotai, he rescues King Osric’s daughter, Princess Yasimina, and confronts the evil Thulsa Doom.

Role:

Thulsa Doom

Starring:

Arnold Schwarzenegger, Mako Iwamatsu, Max von Sydow, Sven-Ole Thorsen, Sandahl Bergman, Ben Davidson

Directed By:

John Milius

17. Clear and Present Danger (1994)

27

11

PG-13

27

11

Jack Ryan is assigned to a case involving the murder of the US President’s friend by a Columbian drug cartel. When it is revealed that the murdered man had a business relationship with his assassin, the President declares the cartel to be a "clear and present danger" to the nation. Meanwhile, unknown to Ryan, a secret paramilitary force is sent to Columbia to wipe out the cartel.

Starring:

Willem Dafoe, Benjamin Bratt, Patrick Bauchau, Harrison Ford, Anne Archer, Joaquim de Almeida

Directed By:

Phillip Noyce

18. The Man (1972)

8

3

G

8

3

After a tragic incident that kills the President of the United States, an African-American senator is made the first black President, since the Vice President refuses to assume office due to his mental condition. However, things turn difficult for the new President, due to the racism prevalent in the country.

Role:

Douglass Dilman

Starring:

Martin Balsam, Burgess Meredith, Lew Ayres, William Windom

Directed By:

Joseph Sargent

19. The Great White Hope (1970)

9

3

GP

9

3

The Great White Hope is a romantic drama sports film which tells the story of Jack Jefferson, an African American boxer, who faces numerous challenges in the world of boxing, due the the color of his skin. However, with the help of his Caucasian girlfriend, he moves forward towards success.

Role:

Jack Jefferson

Starring:

Hal Holbrook, Scatman Crothers, Jane Alexander, Chester Morris, Lou Gilbert, Joel Fluellen

Directed By:

Martin Ritt

Awards:

Golden Globe Award for Most Promising Newcomer - Male

20. Patriot Games (1992)

29

13

R

29

13

The sequel to The Hunt for Red October finds Jack Ryan killing Patrick Miller, a member of the terrorist cell, the IRA during an attack while his brother Sean watches. After Sean Miller is convicted, he escapes from prison and seeks revenge along with his fellow IRA members against Ryan and his family.

Starring:

Richard Harris, Sean Bean, Harrison Ford, Samuel L. Jackson, Anne Archer, Patrick Bergin

Directed By:

Phillip Noyce

26. A Piece of the Action (1977)

6

PG

6

A retired detective has all the evidences necessary for sending two smart thieves to jail. But he agrees to keep quiet provided they consent to work among delinquent youths. Having no other options, they soon start working as career counselors for equally unwilling inner city kids. But later as they start enjoying their job they find their past catching up with them.

Role:

Joshua Burke

Starring:

Sidney Poitier, Denise Nicholas, Bill Cosby, Hope Clarke

Directed By:

27. Best of the Best (1989)

8

5

PG-13

8

5

Best of the Best is an action sports drama film which tells the story of five American fighters, who make their way to Korea, to take part in an international martial arts tournament. When they notice that their opponents are far ahead of them in skill, they decide to forget their rivalries, and work together to win.

Role:

Frank Couzo

Starring:

Eric Roberts, Louise Fletcher, Sally Kirkland, Chris Penn, Phillip Rhee

Directed By:

Robert Radler

28. Gimme Shelter (2013)

8

4

PG-13

8

4

After getting pregnant, a teenager runs away from her abusive mother in search of her father. However, her father and her stepmother disowns her as well. Now she is forced to survive on the streets, until a compassionate priest decides to take her under his wing.

Role:

Frank McCarthy

Starring:

Vanessa Hudgens, Brendan Fraser, Rosario Dawson, Emily Meade

Directed By:

Ron Krauss

29. Gang Related (1997)

8

4

R

8

4

Divinci and Rodriguez are corrupt cops who have been killing off drug dealers, and then selling their narcotics for profit. Things get complicated when they accidentally end up killing an undercover DEA agent, after which the dead man’s partner comes to investigate.

Role:

Arthur Baylor

Starring:

Gary Cole, Dennis Quaid, Jim Belushi, James Belushi, Tupac Shakur, Lela Rochon

Directed By:

8

R

8

4

Sergeant Clell Hazard wants to be an instructor for new recruits during the Vietnam War, but he is disheartened when he is instead stationed as a guard at a cemetery. When Private Jack Willow, the son of an old friend, is stationed under him, Hazard tries to teach him about war, before he is deployed to Vietnam.

Role:

'Goody' Nelson

Starring:

Laurence Fishburne, James Caan, Anjelica Huston, D.B. Sweeney, Dean Stockwell

34. Sommersby (1993)

9

6

PG-13

9

6

Sommersby is a romantic period drama mystery film which tells the story of a farmer John, who goes to fight in the Civil War, but is presumed dead as he doesn’t return. When his wife is set to marry her neighbor, John suddenly returns to her life. Soon, she starts feeling that he might be an impostor.

Starring:

Jodie Foster, Richard Gere, Bill Pullman, R. Lee Ermey

Directed By:

Jon Amiel

35. Three Fugitives (1989)

8

5

PG-13

8

5

Three Fugitives is an action comedy film which tells the story of Lucas, who visits a bank after being released from jail for several armed robberies. Although he is reformed, things get complicated when there is another robber at the bank, and Lucas is taken hostage. He is forced to run with his captor, when it is mistakenly assumed that they are working together.

Role:

Dugan

Starring:

Martin Short, Nick Nolte, Alan Ruck, Sarah Rowland Doroff

Directed By:

Francis Veber

36. The River Niger (1976)

5

3

R

5

3

This drama film takes us to a poor African-American neighborhood in Los Angeles, and it revolves around a poet Johnny Williams, who takes up a low paying job as a house painter, in order to survive and make ends meet. When he learns that his wife has terminal cancer, he grows more worried, regarding his family’s plight.

Role:

Johnny Williams

Starring:

Cicely Tyson, Glynn Turman, Louis Gossett Jr., Jonelle Allen

Directed By:

Krishna Shah

38. Swashbuckler (1976)

5

4

PG

5

4

In Jamaica in 1718, Captain Lynch leads a band of pirates to oppose the greedy acting Governor, the evil Lord Durant. Durant has not only imprisoned his Lord High Justice, taking over the role himself, but he has also evicted the judge’s wife and daughter. Lynch joins forces with Jane, the judge’s daughter, to overthrow Durant.

Role:

Nick Debrett

Starring:

Peter Boyle, Geneviève Bujold, Robert Shaw, Beau Bridges

Directed By:

James Goldstone

5

R

5

4

Officer Lacy is a veteran working for the New York Police Department, who finds himself demoted for his violent and trigger-happy behavior. Responding to a call on the West Side of Manhattan, he finds a musician named Sally, who was kidnapped by a mugger. Although the mugger was unarmed, Lacy kills him and tells Sally to lie to the detectives to make himself look like a hero.

Role:

Rabbit

Starring:

Debbie Harry, Danny DeVito, Lilia Skala, Don Murray

Directed By:

Ivan Nagy

Henry Altmann is always upset and angry. However, when his doctor tells him that he is suffering from a brain aneurysm and will die within 90 minutes, he decides to make peace with his friends and family.

Starring:

Robin Williams, Peter Dinklage, Louis C.K., Mila Kunis, Melissa Leo

Directed By:

Phil Alden Robinson

45. Welcome Home, Roscoe Jenkins (2008)

7

PG-13

7

5

Welcome Home Roscoe Jenkins is a romantic comedy film which tells the story of Dr R J Stevens, a successful talk-show host, who has millions of fans, but has cut off his ties to his parents and his hometown. However, he reluctantly agrees to attend the 50th anniversary of his parents, along with his wife and his ten year old son.

Role:

Papa Jenkins

Starring:

Martin Lawrence, Cedric the Entertainer, Mike Epps, Michael Clarke Duncan, Louis C.K., Joy Bryant

14

The African monarch Akeem is in need of a heir to the throne. Upon learning that he has a long-lost son in the US, he feels that he needs to return to the US, to bring him back to Zamunda.

Role:

King Jaffe Joffer

Starring:

Wesley Snipes, Michael Blackson, Tracy Morgan, Morgan Freeman, Colin Jost, Eddie Murphy, John Amos

48. The Bushido Blade (1981)

4

4

R

4

4

The Bushido Blade is a historical action drama film, which revolves around a steel samurai blade that was to be presented to the American ambassador by the Emperor of Japan, which unfortunately get stolen. Therefore, American sailors and Japanese samurai are sent on a mission to recover it.

Starring:

Toshiro Mifune, Sonny Chiba, Mako Iwamatsu, Mike Starr, Richard Boone, Toshirô Mifune, Timothy Patrick Murphy

Directed By:

Tsugunobu Kotani

49. Soul Man (1986)

5

5

PG-13

5

5

Soul Man is a comedy film which tells the story of Mark Watson, a pampered young boy from a rich family, whose father is unwilling to spend money on his education. He applies for a scholarship but it soon seems that it is only available for African-Americans. Therefore, he decides to use tanning pills to pose as one. He soon realizes that this is going to make people treat him a lot differently.

Role:

Professor Banks

Starring:

Rae Dawn Chong, Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Leslie Nielsen, Arye Gross, C. Thomas Howell

Directed By:

Steve Miner

Exorcist II: The Heretic is a supernatural horror film which tells the story of a teen girl who was once possessed by a demon. Four years later, she finds that the demon may still be lurking within her. Meanwhile, a priest is investigating the strange death of the girl’s exorcist.
